citation.article-title: Gracilibacillus lacisalsi sp. nov., a halophilic Gram-positive bacterium from a salt lake in China.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Gracilibacillus lacisalsi sp. nov.
Gracilibacillus lacisalsi (la.ci.sal′si. L. masc. n. lacus lake; L. adj. salsus -a -um salted, salt; N.L. gen. n. lacisalsi of a salt lake).
Cells form cream, smooth, convex and circular/slightly irregular colonies.
Cells are Gram-positive, spore-forming, strictly aerobic rods (approximately 0.2–1.0 μm wide and 1.0–2.2 μm long) that are motile by means of non-polar amphitrichous flagella.
A spherical endospore is formed terminally in swollen sporangium.
Growth occurs at 15–50 °C (optimum: 40 °C), pH 5.5–10.0 (optimum: pH 7.5–8.0) and in 1–18 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum: 5–7 %).
Hydrolysis of casein, starch, hypoxanthine, Tween 80, xanthine and urea is not observed.
Acids are produced from d-glucose, galactose, sucrose, melibiose, maltose, raffinose, d-fructose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, glycerol, l-arabinose and α-d-lactose, but not from inositol.

Produces esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase and α-glucosidase, but not alkaline phosphatase, lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
Leucine arylamidase and β-glucosidase activities are weak.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
Contains phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and two unidentified phospholipids.
The type strain is BH312T (=KCTC 13129T=DSM 19029T), isolated from Ai-Ding Lake, Xin-Jiang Province, China.
